title: Sorting the Snakes
prompt:
Learn to set boundaries effectively without being too aggressive or passive and master the art of assertive communication.

Imagine your boss, disregarding your workload, abruptly moving a major project deadline forward by a week with no explanation.

Read the answers and assess if they are rightly assertive or too aggressive or passive.

steps.question: I can't meet that deadline. Let's talk about adjusting the scope or timeline.

answers.label: Assertive
answers.explanation: Good job! You respectfully said what you can't do and proposed an alternative.

answers.label: Aggressive
answers.explanation: Nope. It is assertive. You respectfully said what you can't do and proposed an alternative.

answers.label: Passive
answers.explanation: Nope. It is assertive. You respectfully said what you can't do and proposed an alternative.

steps.question: I'm not doing that — end of story.

answers.label: Assertive
answers.explanation: Not really, it is aggressive. While it sets boundaries, it is harsh and closed-off.

answers.label: Aggressive
answers.explanation: This sets a boundary but is harsh and closed-off, lacking collaboration.

answers.label: Passive
answers.explanation: Not really, it is aggressive. While it sets boundaries, it is harsh and closed-off.

steps.question: Um…okay, I'll try, but I'm not sure it's possible.

answers.label: Assertive
answers.explanation: Not really, this is passive. You're avoiding a firm stance, not protecting your bandwidth.

answers.label: Aggressive
answers.explanation: Not really, this is passive. You're avoiding a firm stance, not protecting your bandwidth.

answers.label: Passive
answers.explanation: You're avoiding a firm stance and not protecting your bandwidth. Try suggesting a solution.

steps.question: Oh, okay. I guess I'll just have to work late every night this week and weekend. Hope my family understands.

answers.label: Assertive
answers.explanation: Not really, it is passive. You're hinting at your discomfort but not directly addressing the issue.

answers.label: Aggressive
answers.explanation: Not really, it is passive. You're hinting at your discomfort but not directly addressing the issue.

answers.label: Passive
answers.explanation: This is passive. You're hinting at your discomfort but not directly addressing the issue. This invites further exploitation of your time.

steps.question: Well, you're the boss. I suppose you know best. Even though I'm already swamped...

answers.label: Assertive
answers.explanation: Not really, it is too passive. You're deferring to authority but do it with a somewhat passive-aggressive tone.

answers.label: Aggressive
answers.explanation: Not really, it is too passive. You're deferring to authority but do it with a somewhat passive-aggressive tone.

answers.label: Passive
answers.explanation: You're deferring to authority and minimizing your own needs with a somewhat passive-aggressive tone. This is unproductive.

steps.question: I understand the deadline has moved. To meet it, we'll need to re-prioritize existing tasks. Can we discuss it?

answers.label: Assertive
answers.explanation: Excellent! You acknowledge the change, state the impact, and propose to collaborate on a solution.

answers.label: Aggressive
answers.explanation: Nope. It is assertive. You acknowledge the change, state the impact, and propose to collaborate on a solution.

answers.label: Passive
answers.explanation: Nope. It is assertive. You acknowledge the change, state the impact, and propose to collaborate on a solution.

steps.question: Are you serious? That's completely unreasonable! You can't just spring this on me with no notice!

answers.label: Assertive
answers.explanation: Not really, it is aggressive. This is confrontational and accusatory. While your frustration is understandable, this approach is likely to escalate the conflict.

answers.label: Aggressive
answers.explanation: This is confrontational and accusatory. While your frustration is understandable, this approach is likely to escalate the conflict.

answers.label: Passive
answers.explanation: Not really, it is aggressive. This is confrontational and accusatory. While your frustration is understandable, this approach is likely to escalate the conflict.

steps.question: This new deadline significantly impacts my current workload and the deliverables I've already committed to. I'm happy to discuss how we can realistically achieve this, but I need to understand how we can adjust priorities accordingly.

answers.label: Assertive
answers.explanation: Well done! You clearly explain the impact on you, express your willingness to work together, and seek necessary information.

answers.label: Aggressive
answers.explanation: Nope. It is assertive. You clearly explain the impact on you, express your willingness to work together, and seek necessary information.

answers.label: Passive
answers.explanation: Nope. It is assertive. You clearly explain the impact on you, express your willingness to work together, and seek necessary information.

steps.question: This is typical! You always do this! You don't care about my time or my other responsibilities.

answers.label: Assertive
answers.explanation: Not really, it is aggressive. This attacks the boss's character and generalizes their behavior. It's unlikely to lead to a productive conversation.

answers.label: Aggressive

answers.explanation: Not really, it is aggressive. This attacks the boss's character and generalizes their behavior. It's unlikely to lead to a productive conversation.

steps.question: I'm concerned that moving the deadline forward by a week will compromise the quality of the project. Can we discuss how to ensure we can meet the new deadline without sacrificing quality?

answers.label: Assertive
answers.explanation: Good job! You focus on the project's success, express your commitment, and invite a discussion about maintaining quality.
